ktools 1.0
  • Reference

    Unwrap a facet_wrap plot

    facet_unwrap.Rd
    facet_unwrap(g, plot = TRUE, save = FALSE, path = ".", ...)

    Arguments

    g

    the ggplot2 object created as normal

    plot

    whether to plot (or just save by turn the next args to TRUE)

    save

    whether to save the plot to disk

    path

    where to save them?

    ...

    Arguments passed on to ggplot2::ggsave

    filename

    File name to create on disk.

    device

    Device to use. Can either be a device function (e.g. png), or one of "eps", "ps", "tex" (pictex), "pdf", "jpeg", "tiff", "png", "bmp", "svg" or "wmf" (windows only).

    scale

    Multiplicative scaling factor.

    width,height,units

    Plot size in units ("in", "cm", "mm", or "px"). If not supplied, uses the size of current graphics device.

    dpi

    Plot resolution. Also accepts a string input: "retina" (320), "print" (300), or "screen" (72). Applies only to raster output types.

    limitsize

    When TRUE (the default), ggsave() will not save images larger than 50x50 inches, to prevent the common error of specifying dimensions in pixels.

    bg

    Background colour. If NULL, uses the plot.background fill value from the plot theme.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
g <- iris %>%
  ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  facet_wrap(~Species)
facet_unwrap(g)
}
